title: Before-and-after images of the destroyed Ukrainian city of Bakhmut
description: Bakhmut's leafy green streets are now scorched landscapes, as shown in before-and-after satellite images from Maxar.

title: Belarus pardons opposition blogger arrested after plane’s forced landing
description: Protasevich’s arrest and prosecution sparked major concern among human rights groups. In May 20221, Protasevich was en route from Athens to Vilnius on a Ryanair flight with his girlfriend when his flight was diverted and landed in Minsk. He was immediately arrested.

title: Sudanese hope new cease-fire holds as ethnic violence in Darfur intensifies
description: A week-long cease-fire signed by both warring parties is set to take hold Monday evening amid worrisome signs of a rise in ethnic fighting in the Darfur region.

title: Germany’s ‘China City’ doesn’t want you to call it that anymore
description: The shift in Duisburg mirrors a broader rethink in Europe on relations with Beijing.

title: Why Russia and Ukraine are fighting over Bakhmut
description: Ukraine and Russia have battled for months over Bakhmut, a small salt-mining city in the country's east. Zelensky said "there is nothing" left.

title: Dorm fire leaves at least 20 people dead in Guyana
description: The cause of the fire in the town of Mahdia remains unknown. Within hours, critically injured victims had been evacuated to the capital of Georgetown.

title: U.S. and Papua New Guinea sign security agreement despite setbacks
description: Traveling in Biden’s place, Blinken met with the Papua New Guinea leader and inked the deal, part of broader efforts to counter growing Chinese influence in the region.

title: Assad in Saudi Arabia reflects the Middle East’s new normal
description: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has experienced a rehabilitation with regional powers that is jarring for his critics and opponents.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv focuses attacks on Bakhmut’s outskirts; G-7 summit yields more aid
description: Ukrainian forces on the outskirts of Bakhmut are hoping to encircle Russian troops in the eastern city, where Ukraine’s presence has dwindled.

title: IAEA chief pushes plan to secure nuclear plant ahead of Ukraine offensive
description: After months of failing to broker an agreement between Ukraine and Russia to safeguard Europe's largest nuclear plant, Rafael Grossi is hoping the U.N. Security Council will sign off on a new proposal.
